author: Emma Munbodh
title: Hilton Paris launch Summer of Fun LEGO package - with free toys, workshops and exhibitions throughout August
text:
Paris-based hotel, the Hilton Opera has teamed up with Lego to offer families a different kind of holiday - jam packed with Lego-themed events, workshops and exhibitions.
Their 'Summer of fun with Lego bricks' event, takes place throughout August, and features a Lego-inspired exhibition and workshop for the kids to enjoy this summer holiday.
Included in the package is an overnight experience, buffet breakfast, a choice of one of three Lego boxes as a gift, a My Little Hilton back-pack and 20% voucher at BHV MARAIS - Parisians’ favourite department store.
Families can also get 50% off a second connecting room - ideal if you're travelling with a large group or multiple families.
For the last week in August, children staying at the hotel will be given the chance to build their own Lego-projects as well as attend a Lego-exhibition featuring Paris’ most famous landmark buildings and international personalities, which is open until September 6 2015.
Guests can marvel at models of the Sacré- Coeur and the Eiffel Tower, all made of Lego bricks, as well as impressions of several international personalities, including Laurel & Hardy and Charlie Chaplin.
Visitors can mark their visit by signing one of the bricks and contribute to the exhibition’s very own Lego DUPLO® wall.
Located in the heart of the Right Bank’s Opera district and a short distance from the Champs- Elysées, Hilton Paris Opera was originally the vision of architect Juste Lisch.
Having first opened in 1889 to welcome visitors of the Exposition Universelle, the hotel has undergone a $50million refurbishment that returns it to its former glory in exquisite style.
“We are excited to offer families a fun and different travel experience this summer,” said Sofia Vandaele, general manager, Hilton Paris Opera.
“In the city synonymous with exploration and discovery, what better way to engage our younger travellers!”
Hilton Paris Opera is located within close proximity to Saint-Lazare railway station; approximately 17 miles from Charles de Gaulle Airport; 14 miles from Paris Orly Airport; and five miles from the La Défense business district.
